result.execSummary:
The defendant Anticola Tassia Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: AS TO ALL COUNTS: Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

No use of corporal punishment.
NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.
Successfully complete a parenting of teens class.
Successfully complete QPR Suicide Prevention Training.
Comply with the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare and any Children's Court orders.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anticola Tassia Clark in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Per the agent, defendant has just reported for probation.  The 8/21/15 probation review is rescheduled to 10/23/15.  rmm

Defendant Anticola Tassia Clark in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

As to Count 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days time served.

As to Count 2:
Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction concurrent with credit for 6 days time served.  

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Successfully complete a parenting of teens class.
-Successfully complete QPR Suicide Prevention Training.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-No use of corporal punishment.
-Comply with the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare and any Children's Court orders.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Anticola Tassia Clark in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Battery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anticola Tassia Clark in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  

Arraignment NOT held.
Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment and Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

As an additional condition of bail:
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  A.C.  unless contact is approved by the orders of Children's Court   OR  is supervised by the Bureau of Milwaukee Child Welfare   AND  only if A. C. wants contact

Defendant Anticola Tassia Clark in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.
